INGREDIENTS - 
• Keema - 500 grams 
• Mustard oil - 3 tablespoons 
• Potatoes (cubed) - 3 
• Methis/Fenugreek leaves (fresh) - 1 bunch 
• Onions (chopped finely) - 3 
• Tomatoes (chopped finely) - 3 
• Peas - ¾ cup 
• Ginger paste - 1 ½ teaspoons 
• Garlic paste - 1 ½ teaspoons 
• Haldis/Turmeric powder - ½ teaspoon 
• Chilly powder - 1 teaspoon 
• Jeera/Cumin powder - 1 teaspoon 
• Dhania/Coriander powder - 1 teaspoon 
• Green chillies (finely chopped) - 3 
• Kasoori methis/Dry fenugreek leaves - 2 tablespoons 
• Tomato puree - 3 tablespoons 
• Salt - as required 
• Garam masala (for garnishing) - a little 
• Coriander leaves (for garnishing) - a few


METHOD 
1. Chop the methi leaves (without the stalks). Rub in a little salt and leave aside for 1 hour. 
2. Heat oil and fry onions until golden brown. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, haldi, chilly powder, jeera powder, dhania powder, and salt. 
3. Add the keema and cook over medium heat for 15-20 minutes until browned and half cooked. 
4. Add the tomatoes, potatoes, shelled peas, tomato puree and green chillies. 
5. Wash the methi leaves well, squeeze out all the water and add to the keema. 
6. Cook over medium heat until keema and the vegetables are tender. Add the kasoori methi. 
7. Garnish with garam masala and the chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with boiled rice or chapatis.
